learning_outcomes.description: Have confidence in using appropriate surgical technique for removing skin cancers.
Describe a broad range of reconstructive techniques for repair of skin cancer resections.
Describe the risks and complications of surgical management of skin cancer.
Demonstrate the skill of surgical repair for skin cancer management.
Demonstrate knowledge of the principles of surgical management for dermatologic surgery,

assessments.due_date: Cases will be released on a Saturday, and due for submission by the Friday 13 days later.
assessments.task_description: 12 Case Annotations are submitted throughout the semester, approximately 2 per fortnight. These will comprise a skin cancer lesion image supplied by your coordinator on a PowerPoint file. You will be asked to demonstrate your proposed reconstruction and provide reasoning for the approach, as well as provide alternatives.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments are submitted via the relevant learning module in the Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site for IMED7011
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: You will commence your peer review on the day of submission and have up to 2 weeks to submit your review.
assessments.task_description: Each of the Case Annotations are submitted for Peer Review. You should mark and provide feedback to your student colleagues on the case annotations.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments are submitted via the relevant learning module in the Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site for IMED7011
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: Due dates will be posted in Learn.UQ (Blackboard). Presentations 1-3 are due mid semester, and 4-6 due at the end of semester.
assessments.task_description: You will be required to present six cases that you have managed in your rooms that are required to be written up and presented as Surgical Case Presentations. These are submitted as attached Powerpoint PDF Documents via Blackboard using the template provided.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Surgical cases are submitted via the Learning Activities tab on the IMED7011 course in Learn.UQ (Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
A final summative examination will be administered online at the end of the exam. The specific date and time of the exam will be notified by the course coordinator on Learn.UQ (Blackboard) at least four weeks prior to the commencement of the university examination period.

Further details on the exam and types of questions will be provided on the course Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Case Annotations

Case Annotations are submitted throughout the semester, approximately 2 per fortnight. These will comprise a skin cancer lesion image supplied by your coordinator on a PowerPoint file. You will be asked to demonstrate your proposed reconstruction and provide reasoning for the approach, as well as provide alternatives.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
